name: Santé Refugee Mental Health Access Project

branches.Clients: asylum seekers or refugees living in London, aged 17 or over, who have a mental health issue.

Need to be referred by their GP to the Barnet Link Working Team, who assess

branches.Services: Basic support: food, clothes, toiletries, showers, children's play, access to helpdesk and ESOL.
branches.Address: West Croydon Baptist Church, Whitehorse Road, Corner of St James's Road, Croydon.

branches.Services: Employment skills, alcohol and drug support, housing and benefits advice, health and lifestyle, mental health support, Offender rehabilitation, creative expression, meals, showers, laundry, clothing, leisure activities, safe postal address and more.
branches.Clients: Drop-in centre for adults over 16 who are vulnerable through homelessness, mental ill-health, loneliness, social exclusion and severe poverty.
branches.Days: Mon - Thur 9.00 - 2.00. Friday - Advice by appointment
branches.Process: Mon - Thur 9.00 - 2.00. Friday - Advice by appointment

branches.Borough: Hammersmith, Fulham, K & C, Barnes, Putney
branches.Services: Emergency winter night shelter in churches across 5 boroughs. 100 beds per night; laundry and washing; advocacy and practical support. Two Drop-in Centres in Chelsea and Fulham: meals, advice, doctor appointments Tue pm.
branches.Days: Chelsea Methodist Church Drop-In Tue, Thur 9.00-2.00pm. Women only Wed 3-5pm. 155a Kings Road, London, SW3 5TX. Fulham Broadway Methodist Drop-In: Mon, Tue & Thur 9.00 - 2.00pm during night shelter period only (Nov - April). 452 Fulham Road SW6 1BY. (St Augustine's Queen's Gate SW7 5LP run a drop-in when Chelsea closed. St Andrew's Fulham Fields also run a homeless project drop-in on Saturdays 8.30-12.30; Greyhound Road, W14 9SA. 7 day service.
branches.Process: No referrals needed. Services operate 7 days a week, please contact the office between 9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.

branches.Services: Immigration, welfare and NHS/health advice; social activities, meals
branches.Days: Wednesdays 10.00 - 4.00. Get there early for advice support.
branches.Process: Drop-in Tuesdays 10.00 - 4.00pm. Get there early for advice.

branches.Services: Day Centre: food, clothing, laundry, showers, post, IT access. Some education; ESOL, Conversation etc.
branches.Days: Mon-Wed and Friday: 10.00-15.30. Homeless drop-in is Mon to Wed and Friday 10.15-12.30.

branches.Clients: Asylum seeker and refugee women only.

branches.Process: Book and confirm attendance online or via phone
Check website for location and information regarding sign ups for that particular event. Occasionally must prebook via online form.

branches.Services: Bi-weekly pay by donation (suggested at £5) 2 hour Sunday afternoon cooking workshops
branches.Process: Advance booking essential through calling or email.To book: Call on Tel: 0208 442 4266 or email info@madeinhackney.org

branches.Services: A local friendly non-league football club that has a refugee solidarity group
branches.Process: Matches are on Sundays during football season and admission is £11. Contact group directly via website.

branches.Services: Volunteer gardening project providing participants training in horticulture and horticulture techniques
branches.Clients: Any person experiencing mental health issues
branches.Process: Anyone wishing to participate and volunteer for the Branching Out project should contact the staff team at our Bromley offices. You may phone us Monday—Friday during office hours or drop us an email at anytime

branches.Services: advice on rights to maternity care, charges for treatment etc., telephone interpreting available. Call Thursdays 10am-12pm,
branches.Clients: Migrant women who are pregnant or new mothers

name: Maternity Action Migrant Women’s Rights Service

branches.Organisation: Maternity Action Migrant Women’s Rights Service
branches.Services: advice and training for those supporting or advising vulnerable migrant women who are pregnant or new mothers. Call 020 7251 6189 Mondays and Thursdays 2pm – 4pm, or email
branches.Clients: Migrant women who are pregnant or new mothers

name: Doctors of the World Women and Children’s Service

branches.Organisation: Doctors of the World Women and Children’s Service
branches.Services: clinic and health advice for women and children on the first and third Tuesday of every month at Praxis.
branches.Process: Appointments are between 11am-3pm on a ‘first come, first served’ basis. You can also book an appointment by calling or emailing

branches.Services: Workshops and support for refugee and asylum seeking women, provide accessible and culturally appropriate workshops and information in collaboration with specialist agencies
branches.Clients: Migrant women from the beginning of their pregnancy up until their child’s first birthday
branches.Process: contact Jana Gigl, Project Coordinator (Mondays-Wednesdays only) on 0207 561 5297. Referral form online. Check out Facebook pages.

branches.Services: community: birth plans/support during birth.Targeted antenatal classes in Hackney – by referral only, Thursdays. Weekly visits to Peterborough and Bronzefield prisons to offer support to pregnant women and new mothers
branches.Clients: Women experiencing severe disadvantage during pregnancy, birth and early parenting (mental health, substance misuse, domestic and sexual violence, trafficking, detention and human rights violations overseas)
branches.Process: takes referrals from agencies. A woman may also refer herself, managed by Community Link co-ordinator.

branches.Services: practical and emotional support to women during pregnancy, childbirth and the early weeks of motherhood
branches.Clients: Pregnant women living in Newham or Tower Hamlets who do not have a suitable support network, or have specific needs or healthcare issues
branches.Process: Women can be referred after the 5th month of pregnancy up until the baby is 6 to 12 weeks old. Referral form on website

branches.Services: Baby clothes and equipment, community mums group and one-to one befriending sessions, counselling, unplanned, prisons, abortion
Baby clothes and equipment, community mums group and one-to one befriending sessions, counselling, unplanned, prisons, abortion
Recycled baby clothes and equipment to new mums. Tuesdays between 10 and 4pm for collections
branches.Clients: New mums who receive support through Birth Companions and other agencies
